definition: to be fond of/to have a tendency to/to be prone to
good/well/proper/good to/easy to/very/so/(suffix indicating completion or readiness)/(of two people) close/on intimate terms/(after a personal pronoun) hello
to decrease/to lose/to damage/to harm/(coll.) to speak sarcastically/to deride/caustic/mean/one of the 64 hexagrams of the Book of Changes (䷨)

sentences.english: It's endless work maintaining the building in good repair.
sentences.chinese: 要维持这座大楼完好无损真是个没完没了的活。

sentences.english: Luckily a team of third-party experts will help make sure the house is as good as the buyer says.
sentences.chinese: 幸运的是第三方团队专家会帮助确认房子的完好无损。

sentences.english: Check to see that water and sewage lines are intact before using the toilet.
sentences.chinese: 入厕前要检查水管与下水道管道，确保它们完好无损。

sentences.english: We trust that the goods will reach you in perfect condition.
sentences.chinese: 我方相信货物能够完好无损地抵达你处。

sentences.english: As we walked, I noticed a grocery store that appeared to be intact.
sentences.chinese: 路上我注意到一家食品杂货店似乎完好无损。

sentences.english: Of the 462 cases in the container, only one survived intact.
sentences.chinese: 集装箱中装的462个箱子中，只有一个完好无损。

sentences.english: The fragile goods in the parcel arrived intact.
sentences.chinese: 内放易碎物品的包裹完好无损的到达。

sentences.english: But this aircraft seems to be virtually undamaged, " he said.
sentences.chinese: 但这架飞机似乎几乎完好无损，”他说。

sentences.english: Her face glistens with sweat, but her purple eye shadow is intact.
sentences.chinese: 她满脸汗珠，但是她的紫色眼影仍然完好无损。

sentences.english: Because of the high quality of its construction, most of the Great Wall built under Ming Dynasty still stands intact.
sentences.chinese: 由于其施工质量高，大部分内置的大墙仍然完好无损。

sentences.english: I promise to return your bicycle on good condition.
sentences.chinese: 我答应一定完好无损地还你的自行车。

sentences.english: The glass remained intact after being dropped.
sentences.chinese: 那只玻璃杯坠地后依然完好无损。

sentences.english: I would rather make it to my destinations in one piece.
sentences.chinese: 我希望自己可以完好无损的到达目的地。

sentences.english: After the earthquake, no house remained intact in this village.
sentences.chinese: 地动过后，村子里没有任何房子是完好无损的。

sentences.english: But you expect a bank to be well cared for.
sentences.chinese: 但是您可能更期望银行是完好无损的。

sentences.english: He returned me the tape-recorder undamaged.
sentences.chinese: 他把录音机还给了我，完好无损。

definition: safe and sound (idiom)/to come out unscathed (e.g. from an accident or illness)
to cause damage to/to ruin/to destroy
to destroy in an explosion/to break (by bombing)
to disintegrate/to shatter into small pieces
original spot/previous place/where it was before
